New York.context: This city wa the first capital of the United States after the Constitution was ratified in 1788.

Los Angeles.context: This is the only North American city to host the olympics twice.

Chiacgo.context: This city is home to the world's tallest building designed by a female.

Sydney.context: This city is home to one of the world's tallest steel arch bridges in the world.

Melbourne.context: The city is home to the world's largest stained-glass ceiling.

Brisbane.context: During WW2 this city became the busiest submarine port in the world.

Istanbul.context: The only pan-continental city in the world situated on two continents, Europe and Asia.

London.context: The smallest city in all of England.

Berlin.context: This city is home to the most visited zoo in all of Europe.

Dehli.context: This city is home to Asia's largest spice and wholesale fruits and vegetables market.
